meanings.definition: The passage from the mouth to the stomach or to the lungs.
meanings.sent1: She felt a tickle in her throats when she laughed.
meanings.sent2: The singer's powerful voice resonated through the throats of the audience.
meanings.sent3: The cat's throats seemed to growl playfully as it purred.
meanings.sent4: The throats of the canyon echoed with the sound of rushing water.
meanings.sent5: The throats of the cave were damp and echoed every sound.

meanings.definition: The front part of the neck.
meanings.sent1: He wore a scarf to keep his throats warm in the cold weather.
meanings.sent2: The necklace rested elegantly on her delicate throats.
meanings.sent3: The throats of the giraffe were long and graceful.
meanings.sent4: The throats of the tree branches reached towards the sky.
meanings.sent5: The throats of the swan were slender and graceful.
